parameters.content:
=======================================
            WORKFLOW ASSISTANCE
=======================================
For any questions or support, please contact:
    Yaron@nofluff.online

Explore more tips and tutorials here:
   - YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/@YaronBeen/videos
   - LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/yaronbeen/
=======================================

# 👟 **Sneaker Price Drop Alert Automation**

> *Track sneaker prices on resale sites and get alerted via email when prices drop below your set budget.*

---

## 🟢 **SECTION 1: Scheduled Price Scraping via Bright Data**

### 🧭 **Nodes Involved**:

1. 🕒 **Schedule Trigger — “Run Price Monitor Everyday”**
2. 🌐 **HTTP Request — “Bright Data Scraper”**

### 🧠 **What This Section Does**:

This section **automatically kicks off your sneaker tracking** every day without needing to press any buttons.

* **🕒 Schedule Trigger**: Think of this like an alarm clock for your workflow. It runs once a day (or more often if you want).
* **🌐 HTTP Request (Bright Data)**: Uses Bright Data’s **Web Unlocker** to scrape StockX or GOAT without getting blocked. This handles bot protection and gives you the full HTML content.

### 🛠️ **Beginner Tip**:

You don’t have to be a coder or open the browser. Just schedule it and forget it—n8n + Bright Data handles it.

---

## 🟡 **SECTION 2: Extract Sneaker Info from HTML**

### 🧱 **Nodes Involved**:

3. 🧾 **HTML Extractor — “extractHtmlContent”**
4. 📦 **Function — “Extract Title & Price”**

### 🧠 **What This Section Does**:

This section **pulls out useful info from the webpage** — like the sneaker's name and its price.

* **🧾 HTML Extractor**: Converts raw HTML into a structured format so we can easily extract text.
* **📦 Extract Title & Price**: Goes through the HTML and collects the sneaker name and price. It also converts prices from strings like `"$223"` to usable numbers like `223`.

### 🛠️ **Beginner Tip**:

Webpages are full of clutter. This part filters that clutter and gets only what you care about: name + price.

---

## 🔴 **SECTION 3: Check for Deals & Send Alerts**

### 📤 **Nodes Involved**:

5. ⚖️ **IF Node — “Check Price < Threshold”**
6. 📧 **Gmail Node — “Send Price Drop Email Alert”**
7. ⛔ **No Operation — “Do Nothing”**

### 🧠 **What This Section Does**:

This is the brain of the automation. It **decides whether a sneaker's price is good enough to alert you**, and then takes action.

* **⚖️ IF Node**: Checks if the sneaker's price is below your target (e.g. \$250). You can change this number anytime.
* **📧 Gmail Node**: If a good deal is found, sends you an alert with the sneaker’s name and current price.
* **⛔ No Operation**: If the price is too high, it simply does nothing and ends the workflow.

### 🛠️ **Beginner Tip**:

You're not flooded with emails—only alerted when a good deal hits your threshold. Smart automation = peace of mind.

---

## ✅ **Why This Workflow is Powerful for Beginners**

| Feature             | Benefit                                          |
| ------------------- | ------------------------------------------------ |
| ⏰ Scheduled         | Set it once, runs forever on autopilot.          |
| 💡 No Coding Needed | All logic is visual and editable.                |
| 💌 Smart Alerts     | Only get emails when prices are *actually* good. |
| 🔐 Web Unlocker     | Gets past tough sites like StockX with ease.     |

---

## 📦 Bonus Suggestion:

Want to track multiple sneaker models? Just **clone the HTTP node and update the query** (e.g. `Jordan+4`, `Yeezy+Foam`, etc.)

---

parameters.subject: =The sneaker {{ $json.title }} has dropped below your threshold price.

values.cssSelector: #product-results > div > div > a > div > div.css-cp13gg > div.css-0 > p
#product-results > div > div > a > div > div.css-cp13gg > div.css-1b6n4o1 > div > p
